People are still confused that Hamas is the Palestinians' freedom warriors. I also wish that the people of Gaza will be freed from the TERROR ORGANISATION that captivates them as human shields. The people in Gaza, rightly so, are too afraid to speak up against those building tunnels under their homes or shooting rockets on the roofs of their children's schools (also controlling the education system to teach young minds hate and antisemitism) or hiding weapons in their hospitals. Unfortunately, when Europe sends human support to Gaza, nothing reaches the right hands but the monsters that want to kill, rape, abuse and kidnap. If you'd read about Hamas-ISIS-Hizballa-Jihad's "agenda," you'd realize, even if you are entirely hateful and brainwashed to think that Israel is all Palestinian and Arab nations' problems and that without this small country, the world is a better place, if you'd only do the objective observation - you'd understand that none of those so-called "warriors" will ever stop once Israel is gone. And once Israel is gone, you'll have no one to blame for what will happen next. Don't stand with Israel. Act with Israel. Separate Palestinians from the terrorist who also are ruining their lives. You'd also be doing Palestinian justice. Because they are not animals. They are humans who suffer from being controlled by terror organizations. We should have no 'buts' when it comes to slaughter, burning babies, and genocide. Be human to humans. No excuses can justify 7/10, as you wouldn't do it to 9/11, and many other attacks around the world.

The entire world must condemn taking hostages and attacking civilians. Is this a military or a criminal act by Hamas? As a criminal justice scholar, I wonder if blurred lines between military action and what should be a response by law enforcement will become the new norm. The Oklahoma City bombing was carried out by two anti-government extremists and white supremacists, Timothy McVeigh and Terry Nichols. When the Oklahoma bombing occurred, there was no discussion of a military response against anti-government extremists and white supremacist groups. Anti-government extremists (or terrorists, as per federal law definition, Title 18 USC 2332b(g)(5)(A)) and white supremacists stormed the nation's headquarters on January 6th, and they have boldly threatened the lives of politicians, law enforcement, prosecutors, judges, and top leaders of the U.S. military ever since. In 2022, a white supremacist shot and killed 10 Black people at a Buffalo, New York grocery store. Between 2017 and 2019, white supremacists killed 57 in terrorist-related events inspired by racial hate. Yet, there has never been a call for war or military action against anti-government extremists and white supremacists. However, this was not so during Hurricane Katrina. The military was called on Black people in 2005 and used against Muslims in the war on terror. Neither Black people nor Muslims killed by the military belonged to a branch of armed forces organized by a sovereign state. This is important because military personnel are eligible for certain benefits and protections, such as prisoner of war status. This war rhetoric and military response to Hamas bears similarity to the rhetoric in the war on drugs and the war on terror. Not questioning the war rhetoric and military action of either U.S. or Israel for criminal matters provides cover for the commission of genocide, crimes against humanity, or, at best, human rights abuse. War appears to be reserved only for a certain racial, ethnic, and religious category of people. If Biden supports this response, I must ask is Israel following the United States, or is the U.S. following Israel?
